page.title: 10ECOLOGY
page.content:
In this area we have three regions of great importance to those interested in wild life and nature conservancy. Newhall Burn, which runs very close to our school, Braelangwell Woods and Udale Bay which those of us who live in Jemimaville look out upon from our windows. Newhall Burn is a continuation of the Kinbeachie Burn which drains the rich farming lands of the parish of Resolis, and is an area of great ornithological and botanical interest. In places it is very steep sided and its banks are lined with many trees, oak, beech, ash and elm and a wide variety of woodland plants grows here. As it nears the saltings of Udale Bay it passes through alder wood and willow. Braelangwell Woods are of mixed birch and Scots pine.
continued on page 11
